abstract: General Motors said on Thursday that it would take steps to reduce its financial leverage by $11 billion as it prepares for an initial public offering.
snippet: General Motors said on Thursday that it would take steps to reduce its financial leverage by $11 billion as it prepares for an initial public offering.
lead_paragraph: 4:30 p.m. | Updated Susanne Craig of The New York Times discusses the General Motors financial makeover in a video on the jump. And Nick Bunkley of The Times has more details about G.M.’s plans.

headline.main: G.M. to Pare Down Debt Before I.P.O.
